discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -72,6 +72,7 @@ pytest-cov = ">=4.0"

 pytest-randomly = ">=3.12"

+urllib3 = "<2.3"  # see https://github.com/gabrielfalcao/HTTPretty/issues/484
discussion_comments.comment_body: Fortunately, it is only a dev dependency. That is why I would say it is not that relevant for the release. In the medium term, of course, we have to replace it.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -72,6 +72,7 @@ pytest-cov = ">=4.0"
 pytest-mock = ">=3.9"
 pytest-randomly = ">=3.12"

discussion_comments.comment_body: Indeed httpretty seems stalled. Some projects seems to move their dependency from httpretty to mocket which seems to have mocks specifically aiming at httpretty compatibility.

discussion_comments.commented_code:

discussion_comments.comment_body: This is not necessary since we already have `pytest-mock` which provides a more convenient way to mock objects and functions.
